sn35.70:3.1: 70 Upavāṇa on What is Realizable in This Very Life
sn35.70:4.1: Then Venerable Upavāṇa went up to the Buddha …
sn35.70:4.3: “Sir, they speak of ‘a teaching realizable in this very life’.
sn35.70:4.4: In what way is the teaching realizable in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves?”
sn35.70:5.1: “Upavāṇa, take a mendicant who sees a sight with their eyes. They experience both the sight and the desire for the sight.
sn35.70:5.2: There is desire for sights in them, and they understand that.
sn35.70:5.5: this is how the teaching is realizable in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.
sn35.70:6.1: Next, take a mendicant who hears … smells … tastes … touches …
sn35.70:7.1: Next, take a mendicant who cognizes a phenomenon with their mind. They experience both the phenomenon and the desire for the phenomenon.
sn35.70:7.2: There is desire for phenomena in them, and they understand that.
sn35.70:7.5: this is how the teaching is realizable in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.
sn35.70:8.1: Take a mendicant who sees a sight with their eyes. They experience the sight but no desire for the sight.
sn35.70:8.2: There is no desire for sights in them, and they understand that.
sn35.70:8.5: this is how the teaching is realizable in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.
sn35.70:9.1: Next, take a mendicant who hears … smells … tastes … touches …
sn35.70:10.3: Next, take a mendicant who cognizes a phenomenon with their mind. They experience the phenomenon but no desire for the phenomenon.
sn35.70:10.4: There is no desire for phenomena in them, and they understand that.
sn35.70:10.5: Since this is so, this is how the teaching is realizable in this very life, immediately effective, inviting inspection, relevant, so that sensible people can know it for themselves.”
